Title: Why can't arrow function set an array in Node and Express?
Body:
<p>I have this object</p>
<pre><code>const data = {
  users: require(&quot;../model/users.json&quot;), // initial value
  setUsers: (newUsers) =&gt; {
    this.users = newUsers
 } 
}
</code></pre>
<p>The setUsers arrow function doesn't assign newUsers to this.users, like it doesn't have access to this.users. But if I change setUsers to a regular function it works.</p>
<pre><code>setUsers: function (newUsers) {
    this.users = newUsers
 } 
</code></pre>
<p>Now it assigns newUsers to this.users. Why it does that, I thought arrow functions and regular functions are the same?</p>

Title: How to change the default language and add it_IT.UTF-8 locale to locale.gen on Azure?
Body:
<p>I'm trying to change the default language on the Azure machine hosting my app. Currently, the default language is set to en_US.UTF-8 and is the only one in locale.gen, but I need to configure it to it_IT.UTF-8 to support my Django project.
When I start my app and the Django app execute the &quot;import locale&quot; command followed by &quot;locale.setlocale(locale.LC_TIME, 'it_IT.utf8')&quot;, I get the &quot;unsupported locale setting&quot; error. I suspect that the Italian language is not properly configured in the system.
What are the necessary steps to change the default language and add the it_IT.UTF-8 locale to locale.gen on Azure? Or any others solution?
Thank you in advance for your assistance!</p>
<p>I created a startup.sh file in the home directory (the only persistent location) with the following commands:
echo &quot;it_IT.UTF-8&quot; &gt;&gt; locale.gen
locale-gen</p>
<p>Then, in the Azure App configuration under General settings, I specified the path /home/startup.sh in Stack Settings &gt; Startup Command. However, when I attempted to start the machine with this configuration, the startup failed for unknown reasons.</p>
<p>I expected the startup.sh script to modify the locale.gen file and generate the it_IT.UTF-8 locale successfully.</p>
ContextLabels: Code Snippet, Task/Goal, Error Message, Request for Explanation

Title: Assign subset of rows to a Dataframe using loc / iloc
Body:
<p>I am currently having a database with a set of columns X. I am willing to &quot;update&quot; , using .loc (or .iloc) the content of a row for a certain subset of columns (which we can call Y) from X, but the updated row is then filled with NaN and i'm trying to understand why.</p>
<pre><code>a = pd.DataFrame({'id': [1, 2, 10, 12],
     'val1': ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'],
     'val2': ['e', 'f', 'g', 'h']})

my_row = pd.DataFrame({'id': [7],
     'val1': ['z']})

index = a[a.id == 2].index

a.loc[index, ['id','val1']] = my_row
</code></pre>
<p>I also tried:</p>
<pre><code>a .iloc[index, Y_index] = row
</code></pre>
<p>with Y_index containing the index of ['id','val1'], my_row is a Dataframe with the &quot;new content&quot; I want to assign and contains only the columns in Y.</p>
<p>But even though both doesn't return an error, the updated row is then filled with NaN.</p>
<p>I have tried to assign a single value (like an int and not a DataFrame) and it worked fine. I therefore think there is a way to assign to each column its corresponding value but I cannot find how. Does anyone has an idea ?</p>
<p>EDIT : It seems to be something related to index;
If i change my code for this :</p>
<pre><code>index = a[a.id == 1].index
</code></pre>
<p>Then the operation is a success. The only difference i am seeing in this in this case, my_row and a.loc[index, ['id','val1']] have the exact same index
But this doesn't really help me understanding why and how this is happening</p>

Title: Sorting with UDF when using JOIN
Body:
<p>I'm trying to retrieve data from a CosmosDB container. Essentially the data structure is like this:</p>
<pre class="lang-json prettyprint-override"><code>{
  &quot;id&quot;: &quot;123456&quot;,
  &quot;customerCode&quot;: 123456,
  &quot;data&quot; : {
    &quot;orderNumber&quot;: 222222,
    &quot;customerOrderNumber&quot;: &quot;orderNum&quot;,
    &quot;customerNumber&quot;: 123456,
    &quot;orderLines&quot;: [
      {
          &quot;productCode&quot;: &quot;123456&quot;,
      }
    ]
  }
}
</code></pre>
<p>With all the entries in this order table, I want to retrieve the inner order lines, but sort them by the 'productCode' attribute.</p>
<p>This is the current query:</p>
<pre class="lang-sql prettyprint-override"><code>SELECT l AS orderLine, c.data.orderNumber, c.data.customerOrderNumber, c.customerCode, c.data.orderDate 
FROM c 
JOIN l IN c.data.orderLines
WHERE c.customerCode=123456 AND l.status=&quot;23&quot; 
OFFSET 0 LIMIT 30`
</code></pre>
<p>Unfortunately, CosmosDB doesn't allow this, as it throws &quot;Order-by over correlated collections is not supported&quot; if I try to just do a ORDER BY as you'd do in typical SQL.</p>
<p>Reading this, it can be worked around using a user defined function: <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35584755/cosmosdb-sort-results-by-a-value-into-an-array">CosmosDB sort results by a value into an array</a></p>
<p>I'm not sure though, I can utilise it in my query with it's self join?</p>
<p>Tried this and a few other variations but it doesn't like it, as I guess it's not working with the array at this point. Also tried it in the actual JOIN clause but didn't work either.</p>
<pre class="lang-sql prettyprint-override"><code>select udf.sortByProductCode(l) as orderLine, c.data.orderNumber, c.data.customerOrderNumber, c.customerCode, c.data.orderDate 
from c
join l in c.data.orderLines 
where c.customerCode=123456 and l.status=&quot;23&quot; 
OFFSET 0 LIMIT 30
</code></pre>
KeywordLabels: CosmosDB, data retrieval, sorting order lines

Title: No communication possible with CAN vector Device using python-can
Body:
<h2>Objectif :</h2>
<p>Send and receive data with a VN1630A Vector device from python script.</p>
<h2>Tools used</h2>
<ul>
<li>python-can</li>
<li>cantools</li>
</ul>
<h2>Details</h2>
<p>I am currently trying to send and receive data from a python script on a CAN communication using a VN1630A device. I can see my device on Vector Hardware manager. No other applications are running when I trz except VScode and Vector HardWare Manager. I have configured 2 channel on the software to a specific &quot;python-can&quot; application.</p>
<p>I am using the specific Vector interface of cantools to connect.</p>
<p>I made a dbc Can file with specific messages.</p>
<p>my python script</p>
<pre class="lang-py prettyprint-override"><code>from typing import Optional
import can
import cantools
from can.interfaces import vector
from can import typechecking

MASTER_TO_SLAVE_MSG = &quot;Master_to_slave_standard_msg&quot;

class MasterVectorCAN():
    def __init__(self, channel, dbc_file_path):
        self.channel = channel
        self.dbc_file_path = dbc_file_path
        self.bus = None

        self.db = None
    def open(self):
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        Ouvre le bus de communication.
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        try:
            self.bus = vector.VectorBus(bitrate=500000, channel=self.channel,app_name=&quot;python-can&quot;)
            return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f&quot;Erreur lors de l'ouverture du bus : {e}&quot;)
            return False

    def send(self, counter, Command_sg,Num_selector,Table_Selector, extended_id=False):
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        Envoie un message sur le bus de communication.

        Args:
            message_id (int): L'identifiant du message CAN.
            data (bytes): Les données à envoyer.
            extended_id (bool, optional): Si True, utilise un identifiant étendu (29 bits). Sinon, utilise un identifiant standard (11 bits). Par défaut, False.

        Returns:
            bool: True si l'envoi a réussi, False sinon.
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        try:

            data = {&quot;Counter&quot;:counter,&quot;Command_sg&quot;:Command_sg,&quot;Num_selector&quot;:Num_selector,&quot;Table_Selector&quot;:Table_Selector}
            can_msg = self.encode_message(MASTER_TO_SLAVE_MSG,data=data)
            self.bus.send(can_msg)
            return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f&quot;Erreur lors de l'envoi du message : {e}&quot;)
            return False

    def receive(self, timeout=None):
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        Reçoit un message depuis le bus de communication.

        Args:
            timeout (float, optional): Temps d'attente maximal en secondes. Si None, la fonction bloque jusqu'à ce qu'un message soit reçu. Par défaut, None.

        Returns:
            can.Message: Le message reçu, ou None en cas d'expiration du timeout.
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        try:
            return self.bus.recv(timeout=timeout)
        except Exception as e:
            print(f&quot;Erreur lors de la réception du message : {e}&quot;)
            return None

    def load_dbc_file(self):
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        Charge la configuration depuis un fichier DBC.

        Returns:
            bool: True si le chargement a réussi, False sinon.
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        try:
            self.bus.set_filters([{&quot;dbc&quot;: self.dbc_file_path}])
            self.db = cantools.database.load_file(self.dbc_file_path)
            self.master_msg = self.db.get_message_by_name(MASTER_TO_SLAVE_MSG)
            return True
        
        except Exception as e:
            print(f&quot;Erreur lors du chargement du fichier DBC : {e}&quot;)
            return False


    def close(self):
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        Ferme le bus de communication.
        &quot;&quot;&quot;
        if self.bus is not None:
            self.bus.shutdown()
            self.bus = None

if __name__ == &quot;__main__&quot;:
    channel = 0  # Channel du bus CAN Vector (peut varier selon la configuration matérielle)
    dbc_file_path = &quot;C:\\Users\\MPI4ABT\\Documents\\MATLAB\\Can_db.dbc&quot;
    interface = &quot;vector&quot;
    vector_can = MasterVectorCAN(channel, dbc_file_path)
    print(&quot;Instantiated&quot;)
    if vector_can.open():
        print(&quot;Opened&quot;)
        vector_can.load_dbc_file()

        # Exemple d'envoi de données
        message_id = 0x123
        data = b'\x01\x02\x03\x04\x05\x06\x07\x08'
        vector_can.send(counter=b'x01',Command_sg=b'x01',Num_selector=b'0011',Table_Selector=b'x01',extended_id=False)

        # Exemple de réception de données avec un timeout de 1 seconde
        received_message = vector_can.receive(timeout=1)
        if received_message:
            print(f&quot;Message reçu : {received_message}&quot;)

        vector_can.close()
</code></pre>
<p>I am currently sending a random message and receiving whatever. However, When I run my script, the debugger blocks on <code>self.bus = vector.VectorBus(bitrate=500000, channel=self.channel,app_name=&quot;python-can&quot;)</code>without any error, it just blocks. There is no similar issues on the python-can documentation (Using the version 4.2.2). So it blocks on it and do not go further.</p>
<p>No way found to solve this issue except diving into the vector specific API which could take me a year to resolve this issue.</p>
KeywordLabels: VN1630A Vector device, python script, CAN communication

Title: Exception handling after migration from Spring Kafka 2.6 to 2.8+
Body:
<p>Recently I’ve updated Spring Boot to 2.7.10 and Spring Kafka to 2.8.11 (it was 2.4.5 and 2.6.7 accordingly) and ran into a different behavior in exception handling. I use the  <em>RecordInterceptor</em> that checks some cases and if that check is false then throws an exception. In earlier version it led to message re-read until case check becomes true or amount of retries is exhausted. The new version behavior is different: a message re-read is never occurred.</p>
<p>I’ve found in the code difference:</p>
<p>The <em>earlyRecordInterceptor</em> is now not null (The reason is that <em>isInterceptBeforeTx</em> is now <em>true</em> by default). Running <em>checkEarlyIntercept()</em> leads to following case: when Exception is thrown within <em>RecordInterceptor</em> it’s caught by that block in <em>run()</em> method:</p>
<pre><code>catch (Exception e) {

   handleConsumerException(e);

}
</code></pre>
<p>It leads to logging the exception and stop of further process.</p>
<p>In earlier version <em>earlyRecordInterceptor</em> was null so the <em>checkEarlyIntercept()</em> didn’t invoke <em>RecordInterceptor</em>’s intercept. it was invoked later in the <em>doInvokeRecordListener</em> method. In that case a thrown exception within <em>RecordInterceptor</em> was handled by the <em>invokeErrorHandler</em>, where the exception was decorated in <em>ListenerExecutionFailedException</em>, which led to further message re-read process as I suppose.</p>
<p>I’ve tried to set <em>interceftBeforeTx = false</em> to emulate previous behavior:</p>
<pre><code>factory.setContainerCustomizer(container -&gt; container.setInterceptBeforeTx(false));
</code></pre>
<p>But there is second check in <em>earlyRecordInterceptor</em> assignment <em>kafkaTxManager == null</em>, so the <em>interceftBeforeTx</em> property didn’t change anything.</p>
<p>Is the behavior correct?  What should I do to get previous version behavior?</p>
KeywordLabels: Spring Boot, Spring Kafka, exception handling

Title: Getting HTTP Error 500.0 - Internal Server Error after deploying .NET 7 Web API to Azure App Service
Body:
<p>I am facing an issue after deploying my .NET 7 Web API to Azure App Service. Whenever I try to access the API endpoints, I receive the following error(Log Stream):</p>
<p>Swagger page is opening fine, only getting this error when trying to access the API endpoint.</p>
<blockquote>
<h3>HTTP
Error 500.0 - Internal Server Error</h3><h4>The page cannot be
displayed because an internal server error has
occurred.</h4><h4>Most
likely causes:</h4><ul>   <li>IIS received the request; however, an
internal error occurred during the processing of the request. The root
cause of this error depends on which module handles the request and
what was happening in the worker process when this error
occurred.</li>    <li>IIS was not able to access the web.config file for
the Web site or application. This can occur if the NTFS permissions
are set incorrectly.</li>     <li>IIS was not able to process
configuration for the Web site or application.</li>   <li>The
authenticated user does not have permission to use this DLL.</li>
  <li>The request is mapped to a managed handler but the .NET
Extensibility Feature is not installed.</li>
</ul><h4>Things you can try:</h4><ul>
  <li>Ensure that the NTFS permissions for the web.config file are
correct and allow access to the Web server's machine account.</li>
  <li>Check the event logs to see if any additional information was
logged.</li>  <li>Verify the permissions for the DLL.</li>
  <li>Install the .NET Extensibility feature if the request is mapped
to a managed handler.</li>    <li>Create a tracing rule to track failed
requests for this HTTP status code. For more information about
creating a tracing rule for failed requests, click <a
href="http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=66439" rel="nofollow noreferrer">here</a>. </li>
</ul> <h4>Detailed Error
Information:</h4>Module&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AspNetCoreModuleV2Notification&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ExecuteRequestHandlerHandler&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;aspNetCoreError
Code&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;0x00000000
</blockquote>

                &lt;add name=&quot;aspNetCore&quot; path=&quot;*&quot; verb=&quot;*&quot; modules=&quot;AspNetCoreModuleV2&quot; resourceType=&quot;Unspecified&quot; /&gt;
            &lt;/handlers&gt;

        &lt;/system.webServer&gt;

Title: pipeline restore nuget package from azure artifacts
Body:
<p>I am creating my first Azure pipeline and I'm running into trouble getting it to restore a Nuget package from Azure Artifacts.  I have a default Yaml file and I added a Nuget Task which is supposed to point to my Artifact instance</p>
<pre><code>- task: NuGetCommand@2
  inputs:
    command: 'restore'
    restoreSolution: '**/*.sln'
    feedsToUse: 'Telerik'
    vstsFeed: '&lt;guid&gt;/a765533f-c8a7-49aa-9b83-adcf9b945be9'
    includeNuGetOrg: false
</code></pre>
<p>There's also the default task to restore packages</p>
<pre><code>- task: NuGetCommand@1
  inputs:
    restoreSolution: '$(solution)'

</code></pre>
<p>I created a Nuget.config file in the project root, with the <code>.sln</code> file</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;utf-8&quot;?&gt;
&lt;configuration&gt;
  &lt;packageSources&gt;
    &lt;clear /&gt;
    &lt;add key=&quot;Telerik&quot; value=&quot;https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/OneHRADO/&lt;guid&gt;/_packaging/Telerik/nuget/v3/index.json&quot; /&gt;
  &lt;/packageSources&gt;
&lt;/configuration&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>Its throwing errors for my two projects</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Errors in D:\a\1\s\HR Taxonomy Change Management\HR Taxonomy Change Management.csproj
NU1101: Unable to find package Telerik.UI.for.Blazor. No packages exist with this id in source(s): C:\Program Files\dotnet\library-packs, NuGetOrg</p>
</blockquote>
<blockquote>
<p>Errors in D:\a\1\s\HR Taxonomy Change Management Tests\HR Taxonomy Change Management Tests.csproj
NU1101: Unable to find package Telerik.UI.for.Blazor. No packages exist with this id in source(s): C:\Program Files\dotnet\library-packs, NuGetOrg</p>
</blockquote>
<p>I have a suspicion its getting to the first Nuget task and it can't find the packages that are in the Artifacts and its failing.</p>
<p>Here is my artifact
<a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/r9nT4.png" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/r9nT4.png" alt="enter image description here" /></a></p>
<p><strong>Update:</strong> Still 'no joy'.  I tried your suggestions @johnmoarr and no change.  I tried removing each of the nuget (or dotnetcli) commands and switching the order.  I determined one thing for sure.  The 'basic' nuget command tries to get everything from nuget.org, including the Telerik package and so it fails.  If I put the Artifact nuget command first, it fails for everything else.</p>
<p>I have ready online that you can put multiple sources in your nuget.config file like so:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;configuration&gt;
  &lt;packageSources&gt;
    &lt;clear /&gt;
    &lt;add key=&quot;nuget.org&quot; value=&quot;https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json&quot; protocolVersion=&quot;3&quot; /&gt;
    &lt;add key=&quot;Telerik&quot; value=&quot;https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/OneHRADO/33581106-1fd6-4092-9693-a20196c22142/_packaging/Telerik/nuget/v3/index.json&quot; /&gt;
  &lt;/packageSources&gt;
&lt;/configuration&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>I think my company has some internal scan and threw an error for this believing its a security risk to have two https sources.</p>
<p>I've been looking for a way to exclude packages so nuget command #1 won't try and restore what's in my Artifact but no luck yet.</p>
ContextLabels: Code Snippet, Error Message, Request for Explanation, Task/Goal
KeywordLabels: Azure pipeline, Nuget package, Azure Artifacts

Title: GPIO set/clear with mmap
Body:
<p>Because sysfs is too slow I tried set/clear with direct memory access.
It is a IMX6. The gpios used are here</p>
<pre><code>cat /sys/kernel/debug/gpio

gpiochip4: GPIOs 128-159, parent: platform/20ac000.gpio, 20ac000.gpio:
 gpio-136 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-137 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-138 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-139 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-140 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-141 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-142 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-143 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-144 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo    
 gpio-145 (                    |sysfs               ) out lo  
</code></pre>
<p>So I map the physical 0x020ac000 into the virtual address space.</p>
<pre><code>#define GPIO_BASE_ADDR_4    (0x020ac000)
volatile unsigned *gpio_reg; 
void* gpio_map;
int mem_fd;

mem_fd = open(&quot;/dev/mem&quot;, O_RDWR | O_SYNC);
if(mem_fd &lt; 0) {
    printf(&quot;ERROR could not open gpio mapping&quot;);
    exit(1);
}

gpio_map = mmap(NULL, 
                getpagesize(), 
                (PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE), 
                MAP_SHARED, 
                mem_fd, 
                GPIO_BASE_ADDR_4);

close(mem_fd);

if(gpio_map == MAP_FAILED) {
    printf(&quot;ERROR could not open gpio mapping&quot;);
    exit(1);
}

gpio_reg = (volatile unsigned *)gpio_map;
</code></pre>
<p>and set/clear the value. e.g. gpioNr is 137 -&gt; (gpioNr-128) = 8. This would be the 8th line in the gpiochip4.</p>
<pre><code>void clear(int gpioNr) {
    *(gpio_reg+0x190) = 1&lt;&lt;(gpioNr-128);
}

void set(int gpioNr) {
    *(gpio_reg+0x194) = 1&lt;&lt;(gpioNr-128);
}
</code></pre>
<p>The program is executed with root privileges.
GPIO are exported and set to output at start with sysfs.</p>
<ul>
<li>is the mapping correct? did I miss some additional spacing or alignment issues</li>
<li>is the data register not correct?</li>
</ul>
<hr />
<p>Edit 2023-07-05 11:30</p>
<p>Output is now working better. GPIOs are used for a NHD-14432WG LCD display. Some areas are correctly displayed (about 50-70%) the rest is filled with artifacts. Before I used sysfs, there the output was correct but very slow refresh rates.</p>
<pre><code>void clear(int gpioNr) {
    int reg_index = (gpioNr - 128) / 32;
    int bit_pos = (gpioNr - 128) % 32;
    gpio_reg[reg_index] &amp;= ~(1 &lt;&lt; bit_pos);

} 
void set(int gpioNr) {
    int reg_index = (gpioNr - 128) / 32;
    int bit_pos = (gpioNr - 128) % 32;
    gpio_reg[reg_index] |= (1 &lt;&lt; bit_pos);
}
</code></pre>

Title: How to load pass plugin in new pass manager?
Body:
<p>I have written a pass-plugin for obfuscation and I would like to load this plugin using <code>clang</code> instead of <code>opt</code> in Windows. However, when I use the command <code>.\bin\clang++.exe -O1 -Xclang -fpass-plugin='./BronyaObfus.dll' -passes=bogus-control-flow .\test.cpp -o .\a.exe</code>, clang throws an error:</p>
<pre><code>clang++: error: unknown argument: '-passes=bogus-control-flow'
</code></pre>
<p>Then I use <code>.\bin\clang++.exe -O1 -Xclang -fpass-plugin='./BronyaObfus.dll' -mllvm --bogus-control-flow .\test.cpp -o .\a.exe</code></p>
<p>It didn't load the corresponding pass(bogus-control-flow) as expected, instead, it loaded all passes.</p>
<p>This is my registry code:</p>
<pre class="lang-cpp prettyprint-override"><code>llvm::PassPluginLibraryInfo getBronyaObfusPluginInfo() {
  return {LLVM_PLUGIN_API_VERSION, &quot;BronyaObfus&quot;, &quot;v0.1&quot;, [](PassBuilder &amp;PB) {
            PB.registerPipelineParsingCallback(
                [](StringRef PassName, FunctionPassManager &amp;FPM, ...) {
                  if (PassName == &quot;bogus-control-flow&quot;) {
                    FPM.addPass(BogusControlFlowPass());
                    return true;
                  }

                  if (PassName == &quot;flattening&quot;) {
                    FPM.addPass(FlatteningPass());
                    return true;
                  }

                  if (PassName == &quot;mba-obfuscation&quot;) {
                    FPM.addPass(MBAObfuscationPass());
                    return true;
                  }
                  return false;
                });

            PB.registerPipelineParsingCallback(
                [](StringRef PassName, ModulePassManager &amp;MPM, ...) {
                  if (PassName == &quot;string-obfuscation&quot;) {
                    MPM.addPass(StringObfuscationPass());
                    return true;
                  }
                  return false;
                });

            PB.registerPipelineStartEPCallback([](ModulePassManager &amp;MPM,
                                                  OptimizationLevel Level) {
              MPM.addPass(StringObfuscationPass());

              FunctionPassManager FPM;
              FPM.addPass(BogusControlFlowPass());
              FPM.addPass(FlatteningPass());
              FPM.addPass(MBAObfuscationPass());

              MPM.addPass(createModuleToFunctionPassAdaptor(std::move(FPM)));
            });

          }};
}

extern &quot;C&quot; LLVM_ATTRIBUTE_WEAK ::llvm::PassPluginLibraryInfo
llvmGetPassPluginInfo() {
  return getBronyaObfusPluginInfo();
}
</code></pre>
<p>If I just want to load <code>bogus-control-flow</code> pass, how should I pass arguments to clang?</p>

Title: How to flip geom_boxplot and rescale axis?
Body:
<p>I have a boxplot that I am flipping using <code>coord_flip()</code>. I am also trying to rescale the boxplot x-axis using <code>coord_cartesian()</code> but when I do, the boxplot is no longer flipped. I keep getting the phrase <code>Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one.</code> everytime I attempt to make the boxplot. How can I flip my boxplot and rescale the x-axis?</p>
<p>Note: I have also tried using <code>coord_fixed()</code> in place of <code>coord_cartesian()</code> to rescale but that also did not work.</p>
<p>Example:</p>

Title: Run functions consecutively
Body:
<p>I have two functions: one plays audio, another one async function that should run after. I should run this sequence N times.
But the problem is it runs in parallel. When the audio start playing second function also runs.
The question is: how to run this functions consequently? The second function should run when the audio is finished.</p>
<pre><code>  const [song] = useState(typeof Audio !== 'undefined' &amp;&amp; new Audio())

  function playSong(songNum) {
    song.src = songs[songNum]
    song.play()
  }

  async function finalFunction() {
    for (let i = 0; i &lt; songs.length; i++) {
      playSong(i)
      await secondFunction().then((res) =&gt; {
        console.log(res)
      })
    }
  }
</code></pre>
<p>I tried to add promise, but it didn't help, it only runs the first function.</p>
<pre><code>  function playSong(songNum) {
    return new Promise(() =&gt; {
      song.src = songs[songNum]
      song.play()
    })
  }

  async function finalFunction() {
    for (let i = 0; i &lt; songs.length; i++) {
      await playSong(i).then(() =&gt;
        secondFunction().then((res) =&gt; {
          console.log(res)
        }),
      )
    }
  }
</code></pre>

Title: Using Specification and custom JPQL do not work
Body:
<p>Passing Specification and Pageable to any JpaRepository method working fine. What I am doing is I want to use custom JPQL query method in repository, then I want to use Specification and Pageable instances in it. Pageable works fine, but Specification does not work. I have total 10 rooms, and only 5 of them have inventoryitem(it is another table which has manytoone with room). So my custom JPQL is working, it gives me 5 rooms instead of 10. My pagination is working as excpected. But Specification is not working. In query param if I pass project=2, it should give me zero room. If I pass query param search=deluxe, it should give me 1 room. But in both of these cases it gives me 5 rooms, which means that my Specification does not count. Is it possible to use Specification with custom JPQL query method? If yes what am I doing wrong? Any help of yours is appreciated. Let me show some snippets:</p>
<p>public interface RoomRepository extends JpaRepository&lt;Room, Long&gt;, JpaSpecificationExecutor</p>
<pre><code>{
    @Query(&quot;SELECT DISTINCT r.id, r.nameEn, r.project.id
&quot;
            + &quot;FROM Room r
&quot;
            + &quot;LEFT JOIN r.inventoryItems ii
&quot;
            + &quot;WHERE ii.room.id IS NOT NULL
&quot;
            )
    Page&lt;Room&gt; findAllInventoryRooms(
            Specification&lt;Room&gt; specification,
            Pageable pageable
            );
}
</code></pre>
<p>Here is service(assume that all parameters come correct from controller):</p>
<pre><code>public Page&lt;Room&gt; getInventoryRooms(
        int page, int pageSize, String sort, String order, 
        Long project, Long zone, Long level,
        String search
        ) {
    Map&lt;String, Long&gt; filterParams = new HashMap&lt;&gt;();
    if (project != null) {
        filterParams.put(&quot;project&quot;, project);
    }
    Sort.Direction direction = order.equalsIgnoreCase(&quot;asc&quot;) ? Sort.Direction.ASC : Sort.Direction.DESC;
    Pageable pageable = PageRequest.of(page-1,  pageSize, Sort.by(direction, sort));
    Specification&lt;Room&gt; specification = new InventoryFilterSpecification&lt;&gt;(filterParams);
    if (search != null &amp;&amp; !search.isEmpty()) {
         Specification&lt;Room&gt; searchSpecification = new RoomSearchSpecification(search);
         specification = Specification.where(specification).and(searchSpecification);
    }
    Page&lt;Room&gt; rooms = roomRepository.findAllInventoryRooms(
            specification,
            pageable
            );
    return rooms;
}
</code></pre>
<p>Here are specifications:</p>
<pre><code>@SuppressWarnings(&quot;serial&quot;)
public class InventoryFilterSpecification&lt;Room&gt; implements Specification&lt;Room&gt; {
    
    private final Map&lt;String, Long&gt; filterParams;

    public InventoryFilterSpecification(Map&lt;String, Long&gt; filterParams) {
        this.filterParams = filterParams;
    }
    @Override
    public Predicate toPredicate(Root&lt;Room&gt; root, CriteriaQuery&lt;?&gt; query, CriteriaBuilder criteriaBuilder) {
        List&lt;Predicate&gt; predicates = new ArrayList&lt;&gt;();
        // Loop through the filter parameters and build predicates dynamically
        for (Map.Entry&lt;String, Long&gt; entry : filterParams.entrySet()) {
            String fieldName = entry.getKey();
            Long fieldValue = entry.getValue();
            predicates.add(criteriaBuilder.equal(root.get(fieldName), fieldValue));
        }
        return criteriaBuilder.and(predicates.toArray(new Predicate[0]));
    }
}

@SuppressWarnings(&quot;serial&quot;)
public class RoomSearchSpecification implements Specification&lt;Room&gt;  {
    private final String searchValue;
    public RoomSearchSpecification(String searchValue) {
        this.searchValue = searchValue;
    }
    @Override
    public Predicate toPredicate(Root&lt;Room&gt; root, CriteriaQuery&lt;?&gt; query, CriteriaBuilder criteriaBuilder) {
        List&lt;Predicate&gt; predicates = new ArrayList&lt;&gt;();
        predicates.add(criteriaBuilder.like(criteriaBuilder.upper(root.get(&quot;nameEn&quot;)), &quot;%&quot; + searchValue.toUpperCase() + &quot;%&quot;));
        predicates.add(criteriaBuilder.like(criteriaBuilder.upper(root.get(&quot;nameFr&quot;)), &quot;%&quot; + searchValue.toUpperCase() + &quot;%&quot;));
        predicates.add(criteriaBuilder.like(criteriaBuilder.upper(root.get(&quot;nameTm&quot;)), &quot;%&quot; + searchValue.toUpperCase() + &quot;%&quot;));
        predicates.add(criteriaBuilder.like(criteriaBuilder.upper(root.get(&quot;nameRu&quot;)), &quot;%&quot; + searchValue.toUpperCase() + &quot;%&quot;));
        return criteriaBuilder.or(predicates.toArray(new Predicate[0]));
    }
}
</code></pre>

Title: Can't perform query from databases library's connection pool with async Flask
Body:
<p>I want to use Flask[async] to query data asynchronously using the <a href="https://www.encode.io/databases" rel="nofollow noreferrer">databases</a> library. I want to query data from PostgreSQL using a connection from a connection pool. In order to create a single connection pool for my Flask application, like what's described <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55523299/best-practices-for-persistent-database-connections-in-python-when-using-flask">here</a>, I put the database connection code in its own module.</p>
<p><code>db.py</code></p>
<pre class="lang-py prettyprint-override"><code>from databases import Database
from datetime import datetime

class Postgres:
    @classmethod
    async def create_pool(cls):
        self = Postgres()
        connection_url = 'postgresql+asyncpg://USER:PASSWORD@HOST:POST/DATABASE'
        self.database = Database(connection_url, min_size=1, max_size=5)

        if not self.database.is_connected:
            await self.database.connect()        
            print(f'Connected to database at {datetime.now()}')

        return self
</code></pre>
<p><code>main.py</code></p>
<pre class="lang-py prettyprint-override"><code>from flask import Flask, render_template
from db import Postgres
import asyncio
from flask_wtf import FlaskForm
from wtforms.fields import StringField, SubmitField
from wtforms.validators import DataRequired, Length

async def create_app():
    app = Flask(__name__)
    app.db = await Postgres.create_pool()
    return app

app = asyncio.run(create_app())

class ItemForm(FlaskForm):
    item_id = StringField(&quot;Item ID:&quot;, validators=[DataRequired(), Length(7, 9)])
    submit = SubmitField('Search')
   
async def get_item(item_id):
    query = &quot;&quot;&quot;select item_name from items where item_id = :item_id;&quot;&quot;&quot;
    # app.db.database.is_connected --&gt; True
    async with app.db.database.transaction(): # AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'send'
        item = await app.db.database.fetch_all(query, values={'item_id': item_id})
    return item

@app.route('/', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
async def home():
    form = ItemForm()

    if form.validate_on_submit():
        item = await get_item(form.item_id.data)
        return render_template('home.html', form=form, item=item)
    
    return render_template('home.html', form=form)

if __name__ == &quot;__main__&quot;:
    asyncio.run(app.run('0.0.0.0', port=8080, debug=True))
</code></pre>
<p>This prints <code>Connected to database at 2023-07-12 14:42:46.601021</code> and the connected still exists before the database transaction, but I get the error:</p>
<pre><code>AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'send'
</code></pre>
<p>Why do I get this error, and how can I make this work?</p>
<p><strong>Edit</strong>:</p>
<p>I've removed the line <code>async with app.db.database.transaction():</code> since transactions are for writing to the database. That leaves me with the error <code>asyncpg.exceptions._base.InterfaceError: cannot perform operation: another operation is in progress</code>.</p>
<p>I then removed everything so I just have</p>
<pre class="lang-py prettyprint-override"><code># top of script
database = Databases(URL)

# inside get_item()
await database.connect()
await database.fetch_all(...)
</code></pre>
<p>The query runs, but there is no connection pool now...</p>

Title: Creating a Perforce form trigger to change default description with multi-lines
Body:
<p>I have a Linux based Perforce server that I'm attempting to create a p4 trigger that modifies the changelist description for all users using a template. Single lines are easy, but as soon as I needed to have multi-line, I ran into problems, and found that using ANSI-C Quoting was the only way to add newlines.</p>
<p>I have it &quot;mostly&quot; working, but dont quite understand bash well enough to know what is wrong.</p>
<p>I wanted the script to live in the depot, so it could easily be adjusted without having p4 admin access, so i committed the script into the depot and enable the trigger like this:</p>
<pre><code>Triggers:
    desc-out form-out change &quot;sh %//tools/main/Perforce/defaultChangelist.sh% out %formfile%&quot;
</code></pre>
<p>The script code looks like this:</p>
<pre><code>#!/bin/bash

opt=&quot;end&quot;

if [ &quot;$1&quot; = &quot;out&quot; ]; then
    opt=&quot;out&quot;
fi

if [ &quot;$1&quot; = &quot;in&quot; ]; then
    opt=&quot;in&quot;
fi

if [ -z &quot;$2&quot; ]; then
    opt=&quot;end&quot;
fi

mydesc=$'Jira Ticket: High level summary\n\t- Detailed change #1\n\t- Detailed change #2'

case $opt in
    &quot;out&quot;)
        sed -i &quot;s|&lt;enter description here&gt;|$mydesc|&quot; &quot;$2&quot;
        ;;
    &quot;in&quot;)
        grep -qF &quot;$mydesc&quot; &quot;$2&quot;
        if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
            exit 0
        else
            exit 1
        fi
        ;;
    *)
        ;;
esac

mydesc=&quot;&quot;
opt=&quot;&quot;
</code></pre>
<p>This mostly works, but seems to be inserting a $ into the first character of the description, and looks like this:</p>
<pre><code>$Jira Ticket: High level summary
    - Detailed change #1
    - Detailed change #2
</code></pre>
<p>How can i remove that first dollar sign in the output?</p>
ContextLabels: Code Snippet, Request for Explanation, Error Message

Title: Python Script to Copy S3 contents encrypted through client side KMS Key between S3 buckets
Body:
<p>I have a use case where I need to copy contents between S3 buckets. The catch is that the S3 bucket where the contents lie are encrypted through a CMK KMS key and I need to decrypt it using a different CMK KMS key before storing it in another bucket.</p>
<p>I tried to first fetch the file from S3, and then decrypt it using the KMS key</p>
<pre class="lang-py prettyprint-override"><code>import boto3

source_bucket = &quot;sourceBucket&quot;
destination_bucket = &quot;destinationBucket&quot;
source_kms_key_id = &quot;kmsKey&quot;
dest_kms_key_id = &quot;destKmsKeyId&quot;

s3_client = boto3.client('s3')
kms_client = boto3.client('kms', region_name='us-west-2')


def get_files_from_s3(bucket_name,destination_bucket,kms_key_id):
    response = s3_client.list_objects_v2(Bucket=bucket_name)
    if 'Contents' in response:
        objects = response['Contents']
        for obj in objects:
            file_key = obj['Key']
            file_object = s3_client.get_object(Bucket=bucket_name, Key=file_key)
            encrypted_data = file_object['Body'].read()
            hello = str(encrypted_data)
            # print(f&quot;Encrypted Data: {encrypted_data}&quot;)
            print(&quot;aa&quot;)
            decrypted_data = kms_client.decrypt(CiphertextBlob=encrypted_data, KeyId=kms_key_id)['Plaintext']
            s3_client.put_object(Bucket=destination_bucket, Key=file_key, Body=decrypted_data)
            print(f&quot;File key: {file_key}&quot;)



get_files_from_s3(source_bucket,destination_bucket,kms_key_id)
</code></pre>
<p>but this throws an error</p>
<pre class="lang-py prettyprint-override"><code>1 validation error detected: Value at 'ciphertextBlob' failed to satisfy constraint: Member must have length less than or equal to 6144 (Service: AWSKMS; Status Code: 400; Error Code: ValidationException; Request ID: 68c37cf6-0f1a-405c-9bf2-72f0d43c45ee; Proxy: null)
</code></pre>
<p>In Java, I was able to achieve the same using the following S3 client</p>
<pre class="lang-java prettyprint-override"><code>public AmazonS3 getS3Client(@NonNull final ClientConfiguration clientConfiguration) {
    final String awsRegion = region().toString();
    final com.amazonaws.regions.Region kmsRegion = RegionUtils.getRegion(awsRegion);
    final CryptoConfiguration cryptoConfiguration = new CryptoConfiguration()
            .withAwsKmsRegion(kmsRegion);
    final KMSEncryptionMaterialsProvider materialsProvider = new KMSEncryptionMaterialsProvider(getS3KmsId());

    return AmazonS3EncryptionClientBuilder
            .standard()
            .withCryptoConfiguration(cryptoConfiguration)
            .withClientConfiguration(clientConfiguration)
            .withEncryptionMaterials(materialsProvider)
            .withForceGlobalBucketAccessEnabled(true)
            .withRegion(Regions.US_EAST_1)
            .build();
}
</code></pre>
<p>I wonder if there's any similar/other solution available to this problem?</p>
<p>TIA</p>

Title: Implement set union as a monoid
Body:
<p>Here, I need to define a monoid supporting the set union operation of the set data type below.</p>
<p>My minimum (not) working example is:</p>
<pre><code>import Data.List

data Set a = Set [a]
  deriving (Show, Eq)

-- emptySet is a set with no elements
emptySet :: (Eq a, Ord a) =&gt; Set a
emptySet = Set []

-- member tests if an element is in a set
member :: Eq a =&gt; a -&gt; Set a -&gt; Bool
member _ (Set ([])) = False
member value (Set (x : xs)) = if x == value then True else member value (Set xs)

-- add a member to a set
add :: (Eq a, Ord a) =&gt; a -&gt; Set a -&gt; Set a
add value (Set arr) = if member value (Set arr) then (Set arr) else Set (sort (arr ++ [value]))


instance Ord a =&gt; Monoid (Set a) where
  mempty = emptySet

unionHelper :: a -&gt; Set a -&gt; [a] -&gt; Set a
unionHelper value (Set xs) [] = (Set xs)
unionHelper value (Set xs) [y] = add y xs
unionHelper value (Set xs) (y : ys) = add y (unionHelper (head ys) (Set xs) (tail ys))

instance Semigroup (Set a) where
  Set xs &lt;&gt; Set ys = go xs ys
    where go xs [] = Set xs
          go xs (y:ys) = add y (Set xs)
          

main :: IO ()
main = do
  print (add 1 (add 2 (add 3 emptySet)) &lt;&gt; add 4 (add 2 emptySet)) -- Must return [1,2,3,4].
</code></pre>
<p>Compiler has something to say about the above snippet:</p>
<pre><code>Main.hs:47:40: error:
    • Couldn't match expected type: Set a
                  with actual type: [a]
    • In the second argument of ‘add’, namely ‘xs’
      In the expression: add y xs
      In an equation for ‘unionHelper’:
          unionHelper value (Set xs) [y] = add y xs
    • Relevant bindings include
        y :: a (bound at Main.hs:47:29)
        xs :: [a] (bound at Main.hs:47:24)
        value :: a (bound at Main.hs:47:13)
        unionHelper :: a -&gt; Set a -&gt; [a] -&gt; Set a (bound at Main.hs:46:1)
   |
47 | unionHelper value (Set xs) [y] = add y xs
   |                                        ^^
Failed, no modules loaded.
 
&lt;interactive&gt;:1:1: error:
    • Variable not in scope: main
    • Perhaps you meant ‘min’ (imported from Prelude)
</code></pre>
<p>As I am still just a beginner, I have hard times to find the right syntax. Any help, anyone?</p>

Title: Autoupdate maxdate setting daterangepicker
Body:
<p>I have two input date using <strong>daterangepicker</strong>, <code>input one</code> and <code>input two</code>. I want to know how to make <code>maxDate</code> on <code>input two</code> after user choose the date on <code>input one</code>. I have success add <code>endDate</code> setting on <code>input two</code>, but I need <code>maxDate</code> setting for prevent user choose over the date they choose on <code>input one</code></p>
<p>Here's the html code</p>
<pre><code> &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;input_one&quot; id=&quot;input_one&quot; /&gt;
 &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;input_two&quot; id=&quot;input_two&quot; /&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>Here's js code</p>
<pre><code> $('input[name=&quot;input_one&quot;]').daterangepicker({
    minDate:moment(),
    timePicker: false,
    singleDatePicker: true,
    autoApply: true,
    autoUpdateInput: true,
    locale: {
      format: 'DD-MM-YYYY'
    }
 }, function(start, end, label){
   var selectedEndDate = end.format('DD-MM-YYYY');

   $checkinInput = $('#input_one');

   var checkInPicker = $checkinInput.data('daterangepicker');

   checkInPicker.setEndDate(selectedEndDate);
 })

 $('input[name=&quot;input_two&quot;]').daterangepicker({
    minDate:moment(),
    timePicker: false,
    singleDatePicker: true,
    autoApply: true,
    autoUpdateInput: true,
    locale: {
      format: 'DD-MM-YYYY'
    }
 })
</code></pre>
<p>thanks</p>

Title: How to defer input message within a Service Bus Trigger in Python?
Body:
<p>I want to defer the input message of a Service Bus Trigger, since the message should only be marked as complete when another Service Bus Trigger finishes. However, the only example of message deferral in Python I've found uses a queue receiver (<a href="https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-python/blob/main/sdk/servicebus/azure-servicebus/samples/sync_samples/receive_deferred_message_queue.py" rel="nofollow noreferrer">example from Azure documentation</a>). If I understand correctly, I cannot get the message via such receiver within the trigger, since the input message is locked by the trigger.</p>
<p>I found a <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56439156/azure-function-v2-service-bus-message-deferral">post</a> where apparently there is a way to do this in C#, but nothing in Python.</p>
<p>Is there a way to do this?</p>
<p>Here's the code of the trigger to illustrate what I would like to do:</p>
<pre><code>import azure.functions as func
import logging

from typing import List

 from __app__.config import config
 from azure.servicebus import (
     ServiceBusClient,
     ServiceBusReceiver,
     NEXT_AVAILABLE_SESSION,
     ServiceBusReceivedMessage,
 )

def main(msg: func.ServiceBusMessage):
    logging.info(
        f&quot;complete-message test service bus trigger receives {msg.message_id=}, {msg.sequence_number=}&quot;
    )

    service_bus_client = ServiceBusClient.from_connection_string(
         conn_str=&quot;conn_string&quot;
     )
 
    queue_receiver: ServiceBusReceiver = service_bus_client.get_queue_receiver(
         queue_name=&quot;test-queue&quot;,
         session_id=NEXT_AVAILABLE_SESSION,
         prefetch=5,
     )

    # This does not work since defer_message expects a ServiceBusReceivedMessage, not a ServiceBusMessage
    # queue_receiver.defer_message(message=msg)

    # This call does not return any message, which makes sense since the message is locked by the trigger
    messages: List[ServiceBusReceivedMessage] = queue_receiver.receive_messages(
            max_wait_time=3
        )
</code></pre>

Title: Hide/Unhide column using VBA
Body:
<p>I have a range of cells and I am trying to hide/unhide columns based on their headers. I have used VBA for that.</p>
<p>My table consists of main columns (capital letters) and subcolumns which are values that belong to one main category (lowercase letters). This is a sample of my table.</p>
<div class="s-table-container">
<table class="s-table">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>A</th>
<th>a</th>
<th>b</th>
<th>c</th>
<th>D</th>
<th>e</th>
<th>f</th>
<th>g</th>
<th>H</th>
<th>i</th>
<th>j</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>A</td>
<td>a</td>
<td>b</td>
<td>c</td>
<td>D</td>
<td>e</td>
<td>f</td>
<td>g</td>
<td>H</td>
<td>i</td>
<td>j</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
<td>-</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<p>The first row is not a part of the table. Is just the values of the header columns which will be useful to create the filter. Basically I create a pivot of the values in the first row and then in the VBA code I referece this pivot table and those pivot fields along with range of the values that exist in the first row and the sheet that my table and the pivot table are. The first piece of code exists in the actual sheet I have the pivot and the data table and the second is in a module.</p>
<pre><code>Private Sub Worksheet_PivotTableUpdate(ByVal Target As PivotTable)
    'Run the filter columns macro when the pivot table or slicer is changed
    Select Case Target.Name
        Case &quot;PivotTable1&quot;
            Call m_FilterCol.Filter_Columns(&quot;headers&quot;, &quot;Report&quot;, &quot;Report&quot;, &quot;PivotTable1&quot;, &quot;PivotFields&quot;)
    End Select
End Sub
</code></pre>
<p>This piece of code exists in the actual spreadsheet and not in a module. The references are &quot;headers &quot; = the range of the headers that are in the first row, &quot;Report&quot;= the actual spreasheet that contains the table, &quot;Report&quot;=where the pivot belong, &quot;PivotTable1&quot;, &quot;PivotFields&quot;</p>
<pre><code>Sub Filter_Columns(sHeaderRange As String, _
                    sReportSheet As String, _
                    sPivotSheet As String, _
                    sPivotName As String, _
                    sPivotField As String _
                    )
    Dim c As Range
    Dim rCol As Range
    Dim pi As PivotItem
     
    'Unhide all columns
    Worksheets(sReportSheet).Range(sHeaderRange).EntireColumn.Hidden = False
    
    'Loop through each cell in the header range and compare to the selected filter item(s).
    'Hide columns that are not selected/filtered out.
    
    For Each c In Worksheets(sReportSheet).Range(sHeaderRange).Cells
        
        'Check if the pivotitem exists
        With Worksheets(sPivotSheet).PivotTables(sPivotName).PivotFields(sPivotField)
            On Error Resume Next
            Set pi = .PivotItems(c.Value)
            On Error GoTo 0
        End With
            
        'If the pivotitem exists then check if it is visible (filtered)
        If Not pi Is Nothing Then
            If pi.Visible = False Then
            
                'Add excluded items to the range to be hidden
                If rCol Is Nothing Then
                    Set rCol = c
                Else
                    Set rCol = Union(rCol, c)
                End If
            End If
        End If
        
        'Reset the pivotitem
        Set pi = Nothing
        
    Next c
    
    'Hide the columns of the range of excluded pivot items
    If Not rCol Is Nothing Then
        rCol.EntireColumn.Hidden = True
    End If    
End Sub
</code></pre>
<p>This code basically when I apply a filter in that pivot is searching the value in the range of the values in the first row and when it finds it then it hides all the other columns.</p>
<p>The code works with one single filter. But I want to install 2 filters/slicers. One for the main categories and when I select for example A then it will hide everything except the column with the header A and all the subcolumns of it such as a, b, c. Then the second slicer will filter and only the subcolumns a, b, c. So the end results will to keep the unhided the columns A and all the subcolumns we want to have from the category A.</p>
<p>I dublicate the code i have in the spreadsheet and changed only last reference which is for pivot field (filter). It works for the one filter but not for the other.</p>

Title: Junit Respository test cases
Body:
<p><strong>This is my repository class</strong></p>
<pre><code>@Repository
public interface ExamResultRepository
    extends JpaRepository&lt;ExamResult, Integer&gt;, JpaSpecificationExecutor&lt;ExamResult&gt; {


  @Query(
      value =
          &quot;&quot;&quot;
                  SELECT
                    d.&quot;name&quot; AS domain,
                    COUNT(*) AS totalCount,
                    SUM(CASE WHEN er.is_pass THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS totalPass,
                    SUM(CASE WHEN NOT er.is_pass THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS totalFail,
                    (SUM(CASE WHEN er.is_pass THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) AS passPercentage,
                    (SUM(CASE WHEN NOT er.is_pass THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) * 100.0) / COUNT(*) AS failPercentage
                  FROM
                    exam_result er
                  JOIN public.exam e ON
                    er.exam_id = e.id
                  JOIN domain d ON
                    e.domain_id = d.id
                  GROUP BY
                    d.name;
                 &quot;&quot;&quot;,
      nativeQuery = true)
  List&lt;DomainWiseSuccessRatio&gt; getDomainWiseSuccessRatio();
}

</code></pre>
<p><strong>DomainWiseSuccessRatio is interface because i am using projection</strong></p>
<pre><code>public interface DomainWiseSuccessRatio {

  String getDomain();

  int getTotalCount();

  int getTotalPass();

  int getTotalFail();

  double getPassPercentage();

  double getFailPercentage();
}
</code></pre>
<p><strong>I am using mokito with JUnit5</strong></p>
<p><strong>I am writing test cases for repository method</strong></p>
<pre><code>@DataJpaTest
@ExtendWith(MockitoExtension.class)
@ActiveProfiles(TestConstant.TEST_PROFILE)
@AutoConfigureTestDatabase(replace = AutoConfigureTestDatabase.Replace.NONE)
@TestMethodOrder(MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class)
class ExamResultRepositoryTest {

  @Autowired ExamResultRepository examResultRepository;

  @Autowired ExamRepository examRepository;

  @Autowired DomainRepository domainRepository;

  @Autowired QuestionRepository questionRepository;

  private List&lt;Question&gt; questionList;
  private Domain domain;
  private Topic topic;
  private Exam exam;
  private ExamResult examResult;

  @BeforeEach
  void setup() {
    List&lt;QuestionMcq&gt; questionMcq = QuestionMcqTestData.createMcq();
    questionList = QuestionTestData.createQuestionsList(domain, topic, questionMcq);
    domain = DomainTestData.createDomain();
    topic = TopicTestData.createTopic(domain);
    exam = ExamTestData.createExamData(domain);
    examResult = ExamResultTestData.createExamResultData(exam);
  }
    void getDomainWiseSuccessRatio() {

      // Create and persist domains
      Domain domain1 = new Domain();
      domain1.setName(&quot;Math&quot;);
      domainRepository.save(domain1);

      Domain domain2 = new Domain();
      domain2.setName(&quot;Science&quot;);
      domainRepository.save(domain2);

      // Create and persist exams associated with domains
      Exam exam1 = new Exam();
      exam1.setDomain(domain1);
      examRepository.save(exam1);

      Exam exam2 = new Exam();
      exam2.setDomain(domain2);
      examRepository.save(exam2);

      // Create and persist exam results associated with exams
      ExamResult result1 = new ExamResult();
      result1.setPassed(true);
      result1.setExam(exam1);
      examResultRepository.save(result1);

      ExamResult result2 = new ExamResult();
      result2.setPassed(false);
      result2.setExam(exam2);
      examResultRepository.save(result2);

      // Call the method to be tested
      List&lt;DomainWiseSuccessRatio&gt; result = examResultRepository.getDomainWiseSuccessRatio();

      // Assertions
      assertNotNull(result);
      assertEquals(2, result.size());

      // Test specific values for the first item (Math)
      assertEquals(&quot;Math&quot;, result.get(0).getDomain());
      assertEquals(1, result.get(0).getTotalCount());
      assertEquals(1, result.get(0).getTotalPass());
      assertEquals(0, result.get(0).getTotalFail());
      assertEquals(100.0, result.get(0).getPassPercentage());
      assertEquals(0.0, result.get(0).getFailPercentage());

      // Test specific values for the second item (Science)
      assertEquals(&quot;Science&quot;, result.get(1).getDomain());
      assertEquals(1, result.get(1).getTotalCount());
      assertEquals(0, result.get(1).getTotalPass());
      assertEquals(1, result.get(1).getTotalFail());
      assertEquals(0.0, result.get(1).getPassPercentage());
      assertEquals(100.0, result.get(1).getFailPercentage());

    }
}
</code></pre>

Title: Compiler error: "invoke: No matching overloaded function found" when creating a new thread
Body:
<p>I have the following C++ code:</p>
<pre><code>#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;thread&gt;
#include &lt;mutex&gt;
#include &lt;vector&gt;
#include &lt;chrono&gt;

void ThreadFunc(std::vector&lt;int&gt;* pIntVector, std::mutex* pMtx, int i, int j) {
    std::lock_guard&lt;std::mutex&gt; lock(*pMtx);
    for ( i; i &lt; j; i++)
    {
        pIntVector-&gt;push_back(i);
        std::wcout &lt;&lt; L&quot;Current thread: &quot; &lt;&lt; std::this_thread::get_id() &lt;&lt; L&quot;\n&quot;;
        std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(500));
    }
}

int main() {
    const std::vector&lt;int&gt; vec{};
    const std::mutex mtx{};

    std::thread t1(ThreadFunc, &amp;vec, &amp;mtx, 0, 50);
    std::thread t2(ThreadFunc, &amp;vec, &amp;mtx, 100, 150);

    t1.join();
    t2.join();

    return 0;
}
</code></pre>
<p>When I try to compile this with MSVC++, the following error is thrown:</p>
<pre class="lang-none prettyprint-override"><code>C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): error C2672: 'std::invoke': no matching overloaded function found
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\type_traits(1580): note: could be 'unknown-type std::invoke(_Callable &amp;&amp;,_Ty1 &amp;&amp;,_Types2 &amp;&amp;...) noexcept(&lt;expr&gt;)'
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): note: Failed to specialize function template 'unknown-type std::invoke(_Callable &amp;&amp;,_Ty1 &amp;&amp;,_Types2 &amp;&amp;...) noexcept(&lt;expr&gt;)'
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): note: With the following template arguments:
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): note: '_Callable=void (__cdecl *)(std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *,std::mutex *,int,int)'
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): note: '_Ty1=const std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *'
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): note: '_Types2={const std::mutex *, int, int}'
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\type_traits(1574): note: or       'unknown-type std::invoke(_Callable &amp;&amp;) noexcept(&lt;expr&gt;)'
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(55): note: 'unknown-type std::invoke(_Callable &amp;&amp;) noexcept(&lt;expr&gt;)': expects 1 arguments - 5 provided
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(62): note: see reference to function template instantiation 'unsigned int std::thread::_Invoke&lt;_Tuple,0,1,2,3,4&gt;(void *) noexcept' being compiled
        with
        [
            _Tuple=_Tuple
        ]
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(71): note: see reference to function template instantiation 'unsigned int (__cdecl *std::thread::_Get_invoke&lt;_Tuple,0,1,2,3,4&gt;(std::integer_sequence&lt;size_t,0,1,2,3,4&gt;) noexcept)(void *)' being compiled
C:/data/msvc/14.36.32530-Pre/include\thread(88): note: see reference to function template instantiation 'void std::thread::_Start&lt;void(__cdecl &amp;)(std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *,std::mutex *,int,int),_Ty,const std::mutex*,int,int&gt;(_Fn,_Ty &amp;&amp;,const std::mutex *&amp;&amp;,int &amp;&amp;,int &amp;&amp;)' being compiled
        with
        [
            _Ty=const std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *,
            _Fn=void (__cdecl &amp;)(std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *,std::mutex *,int,int)
        ]
&lt;source&gt;(21): note: see reference to function template instantiation 'std::thread::thread&lt;void(__cdecl &amp;)(std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *,std::mutex *,int,int),const std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt;*,const std::mutex*,int,int,0&gt;(_Fn,const std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *&amp;&amp;,const std::mutex *&amp;&amp;,int &amp;&amp;,int &amp;&amp;)' being compiled
        with
        [
            _Fn=void (__cdecl &amp;)(std::vector&lt;int,std::allocator&lt;int&gt;&gt; *,std::mutex *,int,int)
        ]
</code></pre>
<p>What would be the cause of this error and how can I fix that?</p>
<p>Edit: I made both <code>vec</code> and <code>mtx</code> non-const and now the program works as expected. But what I do not understand is, isn't declaring a variable as <code>const</code> essentially make it a &quot;constant reference&quot; to an object? which make us able to modify its members?</p>
<p>BTW, I'm from a C# background.</p>

Title: STM32G4 cosf(x) allmost 6 times faster than arm_cos_f32(x)?
Body:
<p>Until now I was convinced, that the ARM-Math functions are always faster than the &quot;normal&quot; ones.</p>
<p>To check that, I did a quick benchmark on a STM32G473</p>
<p>The Code:</p>
<pre><code>#define REPS 170000000
uint32_t rep = REPS;
uint32_t start = HAL_GetTick();
float value;

while(rep--) {
    value = cosf(0.0F);
}
uint32_t end = HAL_GetTick();
duration[0] = end - start;

rep = REPS;
start = HAL_GetTick();

while(rep--) {
    value = arm_cos_f32(0.0F);
}
end = HAL_GetTick();
duration[1] = end - start;

rep = REPS;
start = HAL_GetTick();

while(rep--) {
    value = arm_cos_q15(0);
}
GetTime();
end = HAL_GetTick();
duration[2] = end - start;
UNUSED(value);
</code></pre>
<p>The results were:</p>
<ul>
<li>Loop 1 (cosf): 11004 Milliseconds</li>
<li>Loop 2 (arm_cos_f32): allmost a Minute (58 Seconds)</li>
<li>Loop 3 (arm_cos_q15): ~46 Seconds</li>
</ul>
<p>Is there something wrong in my test setup (compiled in DEBUG mode), or is it really true, that cosf(x) from math.h is almost 6(5) times faster than the arm math function?</p>

Title: Struts2 extending multiple packages doesn't work
Body:
<p>I have 2 packages - one for interceptor and other for actions. I am extending the interceptor package in my actions package. After running the app, the intercept method of the interceptor is not getting called but directly Logon Action is getting called. I except that before my action the interceptor should be called.</p>
<p>Any idea why it is not happening?</p>
<p><strong>Struts.xml</strong></p>
<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot; ?&gt;

&lt;!DOCTYPE struts PUBLIC
    &quot;-//Apache Software Foundation//DTD Struts Configuration 2.0//EN&quot;
    &quot;http://struts.apache.org/dtds/struts-2.5.dtd&quot;&gt;

    &lt;!-- login interceptor --&gt;
    &lt;include file=&quot;login-interceptor.xml&quot;/&gt;
    
    &lt;!-- Struts Actions --&gt;
    &lt;include file=&quot;struts2-actions.xml&quot;/&gt;
</code></pre>
<p><strong>login-interceptor.xml</strong></p>
<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot; ?&gt;

&lt;package name=&quot;login&quot; namespace=&quot;/&quot; extends=&quot;struts-default,json-default&quot;\&gt;

        &lt;interceptors&gt;

        &lt;interceptor name=&quot;loginInterceptor&quot; class=&quot;com.example.interceptor.LoginInterceptor&quot; /&gt;

        &lt;interceptor-stack name=&quot;loginStack&quot;&gt;
            &lt;interceptor-ref name=&quot;defaultStack&quot; /&gt;
            &lt;interceptor-ref name=&quot;loginInterceptor&quot; /&gt;
        &lt;/interceptor-stack&gt;
        
    &lt;/interceptors&gt;
    
    &lt;default-interceptor-ref name=&quot;loginStack&quot; /&gt;

    &lt;global-results&gt;
        &lt;result name=&quot;error&quot;&gt;/WEB-INF/error.jsp&lt;/result&gt;
    &lt;/global-results&gt;

    &lt;global-exception-mappings&gt;
        &lt;exception-mapping exception=&quot;java.lang.Exception&quot; result=&quot;error&quot; /&gt;
    &lt;/global-exception-mappings&gt;

&lt;/package&gt;
</code></pre>
<p><strong>struts2-actions.xml</strong></p>
<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot; ?&gt;

&lt;!DOCTYPE struts PUBLIC &quot;-//Apache Software Foundation//DTD Struts Configuration 2.0//EN&quot; &quot;http://struts.apache.org/dtds/struts-2.5.dtd&quot;&gt;


    &lt;package name=&quot;default&quot; namespace=&quot;/&quot; extends=&quot;login,json-default&quot;&gt; 
        &lt;action name=&quot;logon&quot; class=&quot;com.example.actions.LogonAction&quot;&gt;
        &lt;result name=&quot;success&quot;&gt;
            &lt;param name=&quot;location&quot;&gt;logon.jsp&lt;/param&gt;
        &lt;/result&gt;
    &lt;/action&gt;
    &lt;/package&gt;
</code></pre>
<p><strong>LoginInterceptor</strong></p>
<pre><code>package com.example.interceptor;

import com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionInvocation;import com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor;

public class LoginInterceptor implements Interceptor {

/**
 * @see com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor#destroy()
 */
@Override
public void destroy() {}

/**
 * @see com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor#init()
 */
@Override
public void init() {}

/**
 * @see com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.Interceptor#intercept(com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionInvocation)
 */
@Override
public String intercept(ActionInvocation objAI) throws Exception {

    String result = objAI.invoke();
    return result;
}

}
</code></pre>
<p><strong>Update</strong></p>
<p>It works when I change the order of the packages in the extends attribute like below:</p>
<pre><code> &lt;package name=&quot;default&quot; namespace=&quot;/&quot; extends=&quot;json-default,login&quot;&gt; 
</code></pre>
<p>or add interceptor package only:</p>
<pre><code> &lt;package name=&quot;default&quot; namespace=&quot;/&quot; extends=&quot;login&quot;&gt; 
</code></pre>
<p>Any idea why it doesn't work when I extend multiple packages and keep my custom package first.</p>
